writingAnswer.referenceEssay:
Dear Alex,

I hope this letter finds you well. I understand that you are eager to learn Chinese and immerse yourself in the culture. I would highly recommend that you consider studying in Beijing, the capital city of China.

Beijing is not only a hub of historical significance, with landmarks such as the Forbidden City and the Great Wall, but it is also a vibrant modern metropolis. The city offers a rich tapestry of cultural experiences, from traditional hutongs to contemporary art galleries. Moreover, Beijing is home to some of the best universities in China, such as Peking University and Tsinghua University, where you can find excellent language programs.

Living in Beijing will provide you with ample opportunities to practice your Chinese in everyday situations, from navigating the bustling markets to engaging with locals in the numerous parks. The city's diverse population also means that you will be exposed to various dialects and accents, which will further enhance your language skills.

I am confident that Beijing will be an ideal place for you to learn Chinese and experience the essence of Chinese culture. I look forward to hearing about your adventures there.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

translationAnswer.referenceTranslation: China's family values are deeply rooted in its cultural traditions. The harmonious extended family was once a much-admired ideal. It was not uncommon in the past for four generations to live under the same roof. Due to this tradition, many young people continued to live with their parents even after marriage. Today, however, this tradition is undergoing changes. With the improvement of housing conditions, an increasing number of young couples are opting to live separately from their parents. Nevertheless, the ties between them remain strong. Many elderly people continue to help care for their grandchildren. Young couples also make it a point to visit their parents, especially during significant festivals such as the Spring Festival and the Mid-Autumn Festival.
